channel.title: Inferno A #317 Framework
channel.description:
[ul][list][center][size=18pt]Inferno[/size][/center]
[b]Features:[/b] [list] [li]A Flexible Event System[/li] [li]An Entity Based System For Mobile Nodes[/li] [li]An IO Blocking Network Implementation[/li] [li]Login Protocol Decoding Completed[/li] [li]Heavily Documented And Clean Code[/li] [/list]
[b]Classes:[/b] [list][li]Server.java[/li] [li]ServerEngine.java[/li] [li]ServerConstants.java[/li] [li]Event.java[/li] [li]EventHandler.java[/li] [li]PlayerUpdatingEvent.java[/li] [li]Client.java[/li] [li]NetworkServer.java[/li] [li]NetworkDecoder.java[/li] [li]LoginProtocolDecoder.java[/li] [li]PacketProtocolDecoder.java[/li] [li]EncryptionKey.java[/li] [li]StreamUtilities.java[/li] [li]World.java[/li] [li]Entity.java[/li] [li]Position.java[/li] [li]Player.java[/li] [/list]
[b]Packaging:[/b] [list][li]com.inferno[/li] [li]com.inferno.event[/li] [li]com.inferno.event.impl[/li] [li]com.inferno.net[/li] [li]com.inferno.net.codec[/li] [li]com.inferno.net.utilities[/li] [li]com.inferno.world[/li] [li]com.inferno.world.entity[/li] [li]com.inferno.world.entity.player[/li] [/list]
[b]Picture:[/b] [IMG]http://i47.tinypic.com/2lasas2.png[/img]
[b]Download:[/b] http://uppit.com/eca4lfdwpft3/Inferno.rar[/list][/ul]
[b]Past Frameworks:[/b]
The After Years (Blocking Network): http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,627845.msg4266415.html#msg4266415
Northern Lights (Netty Network): http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,608865.msg4231832.html#msg4231832

item.title: Inferno A #317 Framework
item.dc:creator: @iz3_legend iz3 legend
item.description:
@iz3_legend wrote:

Jmood:

One suggestion I have is that you should use NIO, I am guessing you went with a thread per client approach which will end up crushing the servers performance because of the amount of threads you create and then the high amount of context switching, another suggestion came to mind. You should look into the Actor model, Akka is a great framework to look into for the Actor model.

I appreciate the feed back, I have worked with NIO in the past and probably will again in the future. As of right now i’m just slowly proceeding through the RuneScape protocol trying to learn from trial and error with a multitude networking systems and approaches. Thanks for the reply!

Read full topic
